54f271f6-5e8a-47b1-a60c-fc68e25b3ca2.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 5 years. The badge acknowledges the earner's growing dedication to the university and increased impact on the lives of students and the greater UCO community.
54f271f6-5e8a-47b1-a60c-fc68e25b3ca2.name: 5 Years of Service

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 5 years.

3d2e6153-dca8-4f0a-b182-6f0856b62225.description: This credential will certify the skills of budget management & statutory/regulatory requirements for Federal TRIO Programs. Training participants will complete action plans as learning outcome that can be applied to their home TRIO program.
3d2e6153-dca8-4f0a-b182-6f0856b62225.name: TRIO Training: Absolute Priority 2

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate knowledge of TRIO operations for budget and program management
Understand TRIO legislation, regulations, and uniform guidance
Understand guidelines for cost allowability
Determine eligibility of costs as allocable or otherwise
Develop and improve budget management practices through use of resources
Implement internal controls and financial management using OMB circulars
Manage and operate programs that are informed by the legislative and regulatory requirements governing TRIO
Complete a final action plan

ca783c5e-fb44-49e6-86a7-52dd591cd8b1.description: SandTrax is the flagship course from FreighTrax Training designed to provide an in-depth course focused specifically on the frac sand hauling industry. Earners of this micro-credential will gain a foundational knowledge of sand hauling procedures and how they relate to real-world application.
ca783c5e-fb44-49e6-86a7-52dd591cd8b1.name: SandTrax Training

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the qualities of frac sand and the unique role it plays in the oil and gas industry
Differentiate between pneumatic and container systems and know how those differences affect the role of a sand hauler
Understand the importance of journey management and how it impacts the safety of the driver, their assets, and the world around them
Navigate the many facilities involved in sand hauling using proper etiquette
Prepare and inspect all equipment with safety as the central focus
Mitigate internal driving risks, including wide turns and high COG, by practicing safe driving techniques
Mitigate external driving risks, including road conditions and night driving, by practicing safe driving techniques
Prevent personal injury by following safety procedures
Effectively perform essential tasks such as loading and unloading frac sand

a743aae1-9ff3-4e1f-a105-bf147fee04b4.description: This credential will certify the skills of evaluation, recordkeeping, and reporting student/project performance in Federal TRIO Programs. Training participants will complete action plans as a learning outcome that can be applied to their home TRIO program.
a743aae1-9ff3-4e1f-a105-bf147fee04b4.name: TRIO Training: Absolute Priority 1

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate knowledge of federal TRIO recordkeeping requirements
Understand effective resources for conducting formative and summative evaluations
Recognize strategies for reporting student/project performance
Apply recordkeeping best practices to prevent and resolve federal audits
Improve staff performance and project outcomes through the use of summative and formative techniques
Provide accurate student and project data to reporting body
Apply data findings to meet standardized objectives
Evaluate student and project performance
Complete an action plan

f689813c-6162-4738-a869-1fb2aff02b61.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 10 years. The badge acknowledges the earner's continued dedication to the university and increased impact on the lives of students and the greater UCO community.

4071a559-76e9-4fa5-88ed-51f5de26144e.description: This credential will certify the skills of best practices in financial aid, admissions processes and procedures, and financial/economic literacy in Federal TRIO Programs. Training participants will complete action plans as learning outcome that can be applied to their home TRIO program.
4071a559-76e9-4fa5-88ed-51f5de26144e.name: TRIO Training: Absolute Priority 4

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Know college and university admissions policies and procedures
Understand financial aid programs, especially those assisted under title IV of the HEA
Gain knowledge of existing financial literacy programming for students
Aid the enrollment of target students by applying current level requirements
Strategize to improve the financial and economic literacy of students
Use financial aid best practices to meet the needs of, and create opportunities for, low-income underrepresented and non-traditional students
Complete a final action plan

c42c226a-14a5-4c80-93da-d878126fc8af.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 15 years. 4ca3e0af-b266-4e99-92ef-1c2b9cb661d4.name: TRIO Training: Absolute Priority 6

Understand performance reporting requirements and how to adhere to them
Implement internal controls and financial management using OMB circulars

d7d65c82-832a-4a6f-a822-0dde114d84c9.description: Earners were introduced to the Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child (WSCC) framework, and given substantial resources for creating a healthy environment in their school or district.
d7d65c82-832a-4a6f-a822-0dde114d84c9.name: Creating Healthy Environments in Schools

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Gain an understanding of the Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child and the key elements that support healthy environments.
Identify and utilize resources and helpful tools for implementing the Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child framework in their school or district.
Utilize opportunities for reflection and planning to help set goals for implementing Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child in their school or district.
Successfully pass the final exam.

c3c4403a-f62e-4532-8c68-ac922fd3a93c.description: The InternOKC 2022 micro-credential demonstrates participants’ achievement of a core suite of essential professional abilities developed through the 2022 InternOKC program.
c3c4403a-f62e-4532-8c68-ac922fd3a93c.name: Intern OKC 2022

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Complete submission of six micro-reflections following six learning sessions in three core competencies: • How personal behavior, habits and practices impact career development. • How to build, maintain and navigate relationships to build networks and teams. • Build a mindset that fosters problem solving and big-picture thinking.

354704b0-c771-44cf-8a63-9cf06903db43.description: The Cloud Web Applications Development micro-credential surveys frontend and backend web development on a cloud computing platform. The topics include frontend development as a single page application, backend development as a server less cloud function, integration with cloud-based database storage, and security rules in protecting information on cloud storage. The micro-credential can be earned by students in the CMSC 4373/5373 Cloud Web Apps Programming course at UCO.
354704b0-c771-44cf-8a63-9cf06903db43.name: Cloud Web Applications Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Write programs with HTML/CSS and JavaScript for web applications
Develop frontend web applications to the single page application structure using JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and Bootstrap
Develop backend serverless applications using Google Cloud Functions
Write security rules for the web application to access Firebase
Deploy the web application to Firebase Hosting services
Develop a fully working web app

c6024921-97e9-4116-b850-5d858e2eb1d9.description: Earners of the Learning Experience Design badge are equipped to create experiences that help people learn. The required training enabled participants to envision, design, build, and deliver successful learning experiences. As part of this program, they discovered how to use an innovative system called Learning Environment Modeling (LEM) to enhance their understanding of learning environments, help make smart design decisions, and collaborate effectively with others.
c6024921-97e9-4116-b850-5d858e2eb1d9.name: Learning Experience Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Create effective learning design “blueprints” using Learning Environment Modeling™.
Clearly communicate your learning design strategy with collaborators and subject matter experts.
Facilitate collaborative learning design processes.
Support continuous innovation and improvement of learning experiences.
LXD Design Portfolio

538dbad3-ae91-40a1-957b-ed272eabccee.description: The Flutter Mobile Applications Development micro-credential is an introduction to programming for mobile devices using the platform-independent framework “Flutter.” The micro-credential can be earned by students in the CMSC 4303/5303 Mobile Apps Programming course at UCO. Earners will develop mobile applications using the concepts of the Flutter computing platform, user interfaces, applications, usability, and services and how to operate the Google Cloud Platform for mobile applications.
538dbad3-ae91-40a1-957b-ed272eabccee.name: Flutter Mobile Applications Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Write Dart programs for mobile applications on the Flutter framework
Develop mobile applications for Android and iOS devices using the Flutter framework
Use Firebase cloud services to manage users and application data for mobile applications
Develop mobile applications utilizing vision machine learning
Develop a fully working mobile app

a448c661-c712-4539-b45f-a82cfb650bc7.description: The Co-Teaching Online Training Micro-Credential trains learners to become UCO certified to host student teachers in their classrooms.
a448c661-c712-4539-b45f-a82cfb650bc7.name: Co-Teaching Online Training

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will identify research and data supporting the benefits of co-teaching.
Learners will identify, communicate, and implement the 7 co-teaching strategies.
Learners must complete an assessment at the end of the module to earn the badge.

afa58f55-126d-404e-bc2b-28c6a44a42db.description: The InternOKC 2021 micro-credential demonstrates participants’ achievement of a core suite of essential professional abilities developed through the 2021 InternOKC program.
afa58f55-126d-404e-bc2b-28c6a44a42db.name: Intern OKC 2021

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Complete submission of six micro-reflections following six learning sessions in three core competencies:  • How personal behavior, habits and practices impact career development  • How to build, maintain and navigate relationships to build networks and teams  • Build a mindset that fosters problem solving and big-picture thinking

a3b2a2f8-05ed-4d3a-b8a0-6a626fa968fb.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 20 years. The badge acknowledges the earner's continued dedication to the university and increased impact on the lives of students and the greater UCO community.

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 20 years.

d8011fd4-2fd1-49ae-b1a4-400ab82beecc.description: The 2021 Gamechanger Ideas Solution Sprint engages teams from across the University of Central Oklahoma in the process of exploring new ideas and initiatives that could have an outsized impact on the future of the university. Each team brings an idea to develop during the sprint and then showcases the results of the design process through a brief presentation. The Solution Sprint process helps teams quickly discover new insights and create breakthrough ideas for the future.
d8011fd4-2fd1-49ae-b1a4-400ab82beecc.name: Solution Sprint: Gamechanger Ideas 2021

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Deliver Presentation of Solution Sprint Results

e98961f0-a0ca-44cf-ab7a-75262373e7b6.description: Earners of this badge completed UCO's SE 3103 Object Oriented Software Design and Construction course. The course introduces object-oriented (OO) analysis and design. In addition, the concept of design patterns is discussed. Students apply the principles of OO design and the concept of design patterns in developing computer games. By the end of the semester, students have basic familiarity with concepts of class design, OO analysis and design processes, polymorphism, and design patterns.
e98961f0-a0ca-44cf-ab7a-75262373e7b6.name: Java GUI and Software Design Pattern

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Write Java Graphics User Interface programs using Swing/AWT packages.
Develop Java programming using object-oriented software design principles.
Apply software design patterns in developing complex software systems.
Develop Java GUI programs using object oriented software design principles.

a92bffcf-8f66-413a-a811-e51186069da6.description: Earners of the the Occupational Safety Internship Experience badge at the University of Central Oklahoma provides applied contemporary capabilities of Occupational Safety and Health professionals in real-world contexts. Competencies: •Professionalism •Team Aptitude •Adaptability •Safety Professional Essentials
a92bffcf-8f66-413a-a811-e51186069da6.name: Occupational Safety Internship Experience

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Professionalism - Demonstrates professionalism within the occupational safety and health work environment.
2) Team Aptitude - Demonstrates the ability to work as an occupational safety and health professional in a team environment.
3) Adaptability - Demonstrates adaptability in occupational safety and health contexts.
4) Safety Professional Essentials - Demonstrates the essential capabilities and foundational knowledge of occupational safety and health professionals.
Earners will demonstrate proficiency across all four competencies through a supervisory professional experience assessment and an instructor-scored rubric on a final internship presentation.

df7cdbc1-1f63-4d6c-8901-65e102173f06.description: Earners of the Secure System Administration badge have completed UCO's CMSC 4910/5910 Secure System Administration and Certification course. Secure system administration is an essential skill to operate critical cyber infrastructure in a secure and reliable manner. Earners learn and practice hands-on system administration techniques to operate a system with script languages in a command-line interface for efficient and automated management.
df7cdbc1-1f63-4d6c-8901-65e102173f06.name: Secure System Administration

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the essential concepts, components, and terminologies used in system administration policies, regulations, and risk management
Demonstrate proficiency in the usage of script languages
Design and create the automation of computer operational tasks using command-line interfaces and system tools
Recognize script languages for Linux and Windows operating systems, shells, editors, and system analysis and automation tools.
Describe essential concepts, components, and terminologies used in policy, regulation, and risk management.
Complete exams, assignments, and projects.

a46512c9-027e-4d8e-ac40-90b5d9f608d1.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 25 years. The badge acknowledges the earner's continued dedication to the university and increased impact on the lives of students and the greater UCO community.
a46512c9-027e-4d8e-ac40-90b5d9f608d1.name: 25 Years of Service

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 25 years.

6bb52ca4-bcc7-403e-b25e-441918c51e4b.description: Earners of this badge completed UCO’s AESS 3513 Critical Thinking for Leaders course. The Applied Critical Thinking micro-credential demonstrates the ability to apply both leadership and critical thinking skills in ways that optimize individual, team, and organizational performance and innovation.
6bb52ca4-bcc7-403e-b25e-441918c51e4b.name: Applied Critical Thinking

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze complex organizational problems using critical thinking approaches
Apply design thinking to ill structured leadership problems
Lead design thinking processes using facilitation techniques and tools
Design organizational strategies for addressing complex problems
Evaluate a prototype, modifying design strategies based on test results
Communicate innovative solutions to complex organizational problems
Demonstrated proficiency in each competency through the Design Thinking Presentation

c7de4587-aad7-4ff3-83df-d2159890f4c1.description: Earners of the Intercultural Competency badge have completed UCO's Sociology 3990 Intercultural Competency course. This course utilizes the AFS Global and Cultural Competency Certification program and the Intercultural Development Inventory to help students grow in their intercultural competency. Throughout the course, students completed a series of modules and an intercultural development plan further developing their ability to engage in a multicultural society.
c7de4587-aad7-4ff3-83df-d2159890f4c1.name: Intercultural Competency

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Intercultural Development Inventory Assessment and Intercultural Development Plan
Successfully complete all of the modules of the AFS Global Competency Certification program
Attend all four facilitated sessions scheduled by the instructor
Successfully complete the assignments in the Sociology 3990 Intercultural Competency course
Explain the basic tenets of culture and intercultural competency
Apply the cross cultural concepts to their own lives and experiences
Evaluate how cultural competency can shape one’s position in society
Analyze their ability to interact with cultural experiences outside of one’s own culture

1b1bc092-ac63-4172-bb60-366d60cd972c.description: Earners of the Digital Accessibility Foundations badge completed the first phase of UCO’s Digital Accessibility Coalition for faculty and staff. It offers the learner foundational knowledge of web and document accessibility principles and provides an overview of important web accessibility concepts, suitable for both technical and non-technical users. As a result of this course, the learner will be able to apply digital accessibility foundational knowledge to everyday practice.
1b1bc092-ac63-4172-bb60-366d60cd972c.name: Digital Accessibility Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Identify how people with disabilities interact with digital spaces.
Identify fundamental digital accessibility principles and guidelines.
Identify universal design principles and guidelines for learning.
Locate additional resources.
Develop a foundation for digital accessibility terminology.
Recognize components of the best digital accessibility experience.
Develop a value structure & appreciation for digital accessibility.
Complete a final quiz.
Complete a Personal Statement about Digital Accessibility
Participate in UCO's Digital Accessibility Coalition
Earner must complete the 6 week, self-paced, online, asynchronous course to earn the badge.

39b80a32-b13f-48ba-aa13-696d43b3c321.description: Earners of this badge completed a 3-day training conducted by UCO’s Forensic Science Institute faculty. Its focus is on the correct execution and application of forensic science techniques. Forensic Science disciplines included in the training are crime scene processing, latent print collection, fingerprint comparison techniques, blood stain pattern analysis, forensic chemistry, DNA analysis, digital forensics, and forensic anthropology.
39b80a32-b13f-48ba-aa13-696d43b3c321.name: Teaching Forensic Science in Secondary Education

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize different forensic science disciplines and their applications in criminal investigations.

Correctly teach secondary education students to perform forensic science labs and techniques taught in the training in the areas of crime scene processing, firearms and toolmarks examination, fingerprint processing and analysis, blood stain pattern analysis, forensic chemistry, forensic serology, DNA analysis, digital forensics, forensic anthropology, and wildlife forensics.
Apply the content and techniques learned in the training to the middle school and/or high school classroom.
Skill demonstration

0b2fea45-32be-4574-aa42-4128e920a51e.description: The Public Affairs Legislative Overview educates and engages the UCO community about policy and legislative priorities impacting the University of Central Oklahoma community. This resource provides tools for UCO community members who engage in advocacy efforts outlining: governing bodies, policies, Capitol visits, annual institutional messaging and more.
0b2fea45-32be-4574-aa42-4128e920a51e.name: Public Affairs Legislative Overview 2022

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: The training will include the one-time certification along with annual institutional messaging updates which must be completed each year.

55a87e51-d19e-4d3b-a072-832c53abfb6c.description: Leadership UCO (LUCO) is an annual program in which participants will develop foundational personal and professional leadership expertise and skills. The curriculum focuses on five core content areas: Self-Development, Leadership Essentials, Communication, Group Dynamics, Inclusive Leadership, and Strategic Thinking & Problem-Solving.
55a87e51-d19e-4d3b-a072-832c53abfb6c.name: Leadership UCO

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Effective communication skills
Leadership strategies and research
Intercultural competencies
Developing stakeholder buy-in and strategic change management

4b8d3c60-9d68-4667-b9ec-e4beec31a826.description: Awarded to a faculty or staff member who has worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 30 years. The badge acknowledges the earner's continued dedication to the university and increased impact on the lives of students and the greater UCO community.
4b8d3c60-9d68-4667-b9ec-e4beec31a826.name: 30 Years of Service

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have worked for the University of Central Oklahoma for at least 30 years.

2ad02a81-d088-4d13-b84e-eb8574e9298a.description: Students can earn this micro-credential by completing UCO’s CMSC 4343/5343 Cyber Operations course, which introduces the core concepts and hands-on techniques used in penetration testing, vulnerability discovery, and cyber operations. Students will learn about vulnerabilities—what they are, how to discover them, and how to exploit them. Using this knowledge, they will practice secure system and software hardening.
2ad02a81-d088-4d13-b84e-eb8574e9298a.name: Cyber Operations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the concepts and knowledge about vulnerabilities
Gather information to discover vulnerabilities
Exploit and test the vulnerabilities of systems and software
Harden systems and software against vulnerabilities
Final exam
Final project

d07d5119-c00a-4390-a158-d67c0bef704b.description: Participants will strategically target an accessibility challenge in their area of influence. Working collaboratively and individually, participants will work through the process of developing the components for a structured plan with a path towards addressing the challenges identified. Along the way there will be in-person and virtual gatherings, including hands-on training sessions covering tools for use in testing and improving accessibility.
d07d5119-c00a-4390-a158-d67c0bef704b.name: Digital Accessibility Planning

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Examine digital accessibility best practices and guidelines.
Examine the components of a digital accessibility implementation plan.
Design digitally accessible content.
Develop components of an implementation plan.
Examine digital accessibility evaluation tools.
Share completed implementation plan with cohort.
Identify gaps in departmental digital accessibility best practices.
Apply web accessibility decision-making to different scenarios.
Demonstrate accessibility advocacy at department/division level.

d9156cc7-9dee-49d0-84a1-6597db6e5fb2.description: Earners of the Diversity & Inclusion Public Speaking badge through UCO's Office of Diversity and Inclusion explored and identified the nuances of their cultural backgrounds while developing addresses, speeches, and commentary about their passions. Participants constructed and delivered persuasive commentary geared toward celebration, building community, advocacy, and education.
d9156cc7-9dee-49d0-84a1-6597db6e5fb2.name: Diversity & Inclusion Public Speaking

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the process of crafting persuasive verbal communication.
Engage in the process of identifying the needs and expectations of the target audience and crafting verbal commentary to accommodate.
Critically examine how an individual's personal lived experiences influences their perspective and can be used to craft persuasive commentary.
Participants constructed and delivered persuasive commentary geared toward celebration, building community, advocacy, and education.

skills.name: Writing and Preparing an Effective Speech

f14f8f48-69bb-4652-80bb-a053472f82c8.description: Earners of the Coaching & Mentoring badge have completed UCO's Coaching and Mentoring the Adult Learner course through the Master of Education in Adult and Higher Education program. Earners have an understanding of basic helping skills, knowledge of types of coaching, and theories of coaching and mentoring adults in corporate, non-profit, and educational settings.
f14f8f48-69bb-4652-80bb-a053472f82c8.name: Coaching and Mentoring

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate a basic understanding of coaching/mentoring theory.
Synthesize their skills, knowledge and values of coaching and mentoring.
Demonstrate skills of negotiating agreements with clients.
Set workable goals with clients.
Describe various types and approaches to coaching and mentoring.
Identify personal strengths and goals related to coaching and mentoring.
Demonstrate skills in listening and relationship building.
Enable insight and learning in others.
Basic Coaching Experience Skill Simulation
Self-Reflection Prompts

f39f92a7-32ab-4bc4-b81a-20b05f81e8dc.description: Students can earn this micro-credential by completing UCO’s CMSC 3833 course, Computer Organization and Architecture II, which introduces the concepts of memory system architecture, interfacing and communication of computer elements, functional organization, multiprocessing, alternate architectures, performance enhancements, and assembly language programming.
f39f92a7-32ab-4bc4-b81a-20b05f81e8dc.name: Computer Architecture and Assembly Language Programming

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the concepts and knowledge about computer architectures
Describe the concepts of cache, virtual memory, I/O, and CPU architectures
Demonstrate proficiency in creating programs using an assembly language
Demonstrate proficiency in understanding the design decisions of computer architectures
Final exam
Final project

9cc56878-f198-46b7-940e-813fbce6c61a.description: Earners of the Incident Analysis and Response badge have completed UCO's CMSC 4910/5910 Incident Analysis and Response I course. This course introduces the core knowledge and skill sets for incident response, system analysis, and security controls. Earners learn hands-on techniques to investigate the symptoms of attacks and perform comprehensive analysis to discover the details of attack damages and recover/protect the systems from future attacks.
9cc56878-f198-46b7-940e-813fbce6c61a.name: Incident Analysis and Response

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the essential concepts, components, and terminologies used in system administration policies, regulations, and risk management.
Demonstrate proficiency in the usage of script languages.
Design and create the automation of computer operational tasks using command-line interfaces and system tools.
Recognize script languages for Linux and Windows operating systems, shells, editors, and system analysis and automation tools.
Describe essential concepts, components, and terminologies.
Complete final exams, lab assignments, and projects.

022cbea8-9449-45e3-aba1-61382afecf3e.description: During the 9-month Management Development Program course (MDP) participants learned and applied new supervisory knowledge and methods to strengthen their management competencies. The MDP is designed to enhance skill sets and prepare supervisors for success as they lead at UCO. Successful supervisors embrace a mindset of continuous development and strive to master supervisory competencies and effectively guide and empower others to accomplish organizational goals and objectives.
022cbea8-9449-45e3-aba1-61382afecf3e.name: Management Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Training in leadership and management.
Communication skills- creating a culture of accountability and addressing conflict.
Employee motivation and retention.
Giving and receiving feedback.
Change management.
UCO specific policies and procedures.

0bbf2d87-98c9-4ff9-b33b-28f1ab7c44d9.description: Earners of the Raspberry Pi and Cloud Web Interface badge have completed UCO's CMSC 4313/5313 Internet of Things course. The course studies the ‘things’ that make up the Internet of Things (loT). The topics include what these ‘things’ are, how they are connected, how they communicate with cloud services, how the large set of data collected at IoT can be stored in the cloud storage, and how such data can be utilized. Security and privacy issues on IoT are also examined.
0bbf2d87-98c9-4ff9-b33b-28f1ab7c44d9.name: Raspberry Pi and Cloud Web Interface

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Install and configure an operating system on the Raspberry Pi single-board computer.
Write application programs for a single-board computer, including the interface programs to use controllers and sensors attached to the single-board computer.
Use a cloud services to monitor and control the single-board computer.
Explain the security and privacy issues in Internet of Things environment.
Develop programs for both Raspberry Pi single board computer and cloud web app interface.

fea263bc-d49d-494a-a997-b8ddbf78a3f8.description: Earners of the Diversity & Inclusion Event Planning & Logistics badge offered through UCO's Office of Diversity & Inclusion explored and identified the nuances of their cultural backgrounds and passions while developing programs and initiatives. Participants actively planned and executed programs geared toward the celebration, community building, advocacy, and education for historically forgotten populations.
fea263bc-d49d-494a-a997-b8ddbf78a3f8.name: Diversity & Inclusion Event Planning & Logistics

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Examine and identify the scope, purpose, and goals of the event / program as it pertains to celebration, advocacy, and education with regard to DEI topics.
Conduct thorough assessment of resources needed to ensure successful event / program.
Identify and incorporate appropriate event elements, services, and layouts to meet the goals and objectives of the event / program.
Skill demonstration of planning and executing programs geared toward the celebration, community building, advocacy, and education for historically forgotten populations

ba098317-9010-4222-8413-4b7dca71b9f7.description: Earners of the Diversity Peer Educators digital badge offered through UCO's Office of Diversity & Inclusion engaged with the subjects of equity, diversity, culture, and inclusion through their work in researching, creating, and facilitating presentations and workshops for the campus community.
ba098317-9010-4222-8413-4b7dca71b9f7.name: Diversity Peer Educator

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Examine the role of culture, diversity, and inclusion in their own lived experiences.
Engage in regular self-reflection regarding their Diversity Peer Educator experiences.
Identify barriers to inclusion within society.
Advisor critique of presentation and workshop.

264d542e-310e-4b9d-a3d0-8e197b50ae91.description: This course is designed to explain the function and application of audio effects. Whether you're editing videos, recording music, or working on a podcast, this course will help you leverage audio effects to make your sound as good as it can be.
264d542e-310e-4b9d-a3d0-8e197b50ae91.name: Intro to Audio Effects

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Learn the basic function and application of equalizers, compressors, reverb and delay.
Pass exam at the end of the course.

3d4a35c8-2c28-4fa0-844c-3ee7848b40ab.description: There are a myriad of evidential challenges for forensic investigators in the digital age. Through completing UCO's Digital Forensics academic course, students earned the Collection and Preservation of Digital Evidence Micro-credential. Students learned from Forensic Science professor and former Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation Deputy Inspector Mark McCoy, Ed.D. as he taught the proper protocols for the collection and preservation of digital evidence in a forensically sound manner.
3d4a35c8-2c28-4fa0-844c-3ee7848b40ab.name: Collection and Preservation of Digital Evidence

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Rules of evidence and the IACIS Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct as applicable to computer forensics
Proper computer search and seizure methodologies to include photographic and documentation procedures.
Demonstrate the ability to preview evidence on a computer in a forensically sound manner.
Demonstrate the techniques to make a forensic duplicate of digital evidence at a crime scene.
Explain on-scene actions taken for the preservation of physical and volatile digital evidence including the proper handling of mobile phones.
Establish, maintain and document a forensically sound examination environment

4a02fedb-022b-4269-91be-1d6ad354ddfa.description: Participants viewed concepts of race, culture, privilege, bias, prejudice, & discrimination through a lens of lived experience. They examined & evaluated their own perceptions about self & others based on own lived experiences & created spaces for meaningful & transformative conversations. Participants explored the importance of diversity on campus & the wider world & how diversity enhances the environment.
4a02fedb-022b-4269-91be-1d6ad354ddfa.name: Diversity Leadership Institute

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Learn the importance of communicating with peers who come from different lived experiences.
Understand the importance of dialogue vs. debate, and the role of each in communicating with others.
Explore their social and cultural identities and how those relate to their goals as well as how social and cultural identities shape larger goals and ideals.
Apply their knowledge gained through DLI to their own roles as leaders on campus.
DLI includes interactive, engaging, & supportive activities, workshops, & discussions which work to build culturally competent leaders.

88f4b143-140b-474d-8fed-3a0890b6101d.description: The Introduction to Forensic Science micro-credential is designed to provide the learner with a comprehensive understanding of today’s crime laboratories and investigative techniques used in the proper collection, preservation, and analysis of evidence. The learner will be introduced to scientific, technological, and experientially based procedures as they are applied in today’s criminal justice system.
88f4b143-140b-474d-8fed-3a0890b6101d.name: Introduction to Forensic Science

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the techniques, skills, and limitations of the modern forensic science laboratory.
Evaluate the limitations of physical evidence through science, technology, and experientially based disciplines.
Distinguish the proper procedures to recognize, collect, and preserve evidence correctly.

Describe, in basic terms, the scientific, technological, and experientially based principles involved in the techniques used in forensic science laboratories and the need for a structured quality assurance program.
Analyze the interconnectivity between criminal investigators, the law, and forensic science.
Demonstrate, through problem-solving skills, a comprehensive and innovative understanding of evidence, and the ability of forensic science to assist in investigations.
Recognize the importance of ethical behavior in forensic science.

a1e6fa1d-7d58-4a41-9081-37bfed75f09f.description: This program is designed to help new and advancing professionals build essential career development and advancement skills. The Workforce Advantage program provides the tools for personal branding, relationship building, and reputation management.
a1e6fa1d-7d58-4a41-9081-37bfed75f09f.name: Workforce Advantage

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients must score at least 80% on the final exam. Exam topics are as follows: Personal Branding – Learn how to build a set of professional traits that present value to employers and clients. Relationship Building – Learn to connect with professional teammates through training in communication, teamwork, expectations, respect, and empathy. Reputation Management – Create a lasting, positive image for the employee and the organization with training in business fundamentals.

skills.name: How To Build Reputation And Trust

a1f07534-405d-41a2-a3cb-3b9e19fce7ee.description: One of the most eye-catching sites in a modern studio is the modular synthesizer (you know, the wall of blinking lights and knobs connected with a tangled network of patch cables that seems to generate ideas by itself). This course is designed to introduce the foundational concepts of modular synthesis and explore the unique workflows that this format provides using the free program VCV Rack, so you can start working in a modular synth environment for free!
a1f07534-405d-41a2-a3cb-3b9e19fce7ee.name: Modular Synthesis 1

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize basics of creating and modifying sound on a modular synth.
Identify basics of working in the free program VCV Rack.
Identify commonly used tools and audio synthesis
Identify components of VCV rack and how to use them.
Describe how eurorack/ modular synthesizers work together.
Use VCV rack
Create more effective work flows.
Use the tools as a generator for new songs.
Complete final quiz assessment.

88c44ce0-08dc-4e7e-8b32-10389f5ef718.description: Earners of the Python Fundamentals micro-credential have completed UCO’s ENGR4910/5910 or PSM910. This 8-week course covers the essentials of data science and visualization using Python, one of the most in-demand programming languages in the field today. The micro-credential aims to give you the practical skills needed to structure, read, and analyze various types of data and create powerful visualizations to communicate insights with impact. No prior background in programming is required.
88c44ce0-08dc-4e7e-8b32-10389f5ef718.name: Python Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand Python language syntax.
Be familiar with Jupyter notebooks.
Understand and use data visualization.
Import and clean data.
Experience working with NumPy arrays.
Foundational usage of statistical tools for working with data sets.
Demonstrate proficiency in pandas Series and pandas DataFrames.
Problem-solve when working with CSV and Excel data sources.

c9406819-260d-42e0-a946-3d49aa2d4da9.description: Earners of this badge have completed UCO's NTRN 3131 - Food Safety and Sanitation academic course and have passed the official ServSafe Certification exam. ServSafe training is designed by food service and safety professionals, and it meets the requirements of state and federal laws and regulations. Earners learn the importance of safe handling of food, forms of contaminations, hazards in the flow of food, purchasing, receiving & storage of food as well as additional topics.
c9406819-260d-42e0-a946-3d49aa2d4da9.name: ServSafe

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze data for assessment and evaluate data to be used in decision-making for continuous quality improvement.
Describe safety principles related to food, personnel and consumers.
Successfully pass the official ServSafe exam.

e9e7e025-e294-41f8-a863-0cb3e62c9982.description: UCO Solution Sprints are designed to explore new ideas and initiatives that could have an impact on the future of the university. The Solution Sprint process helps teams quickly discover new insights and create breakthrough ideas for the future. The earner of this badge served in the role of Activator for the solution sprint. The Activator is a change agent and helps to remove barriers to action and successfully navigate change management processes.

b01123b2-4ac9-4aed-9620-d959a262586f.description: The Public Affairs Legislative Overview educates and engages the UCO community about policy and legislative priorities impacting the University of Central Oklahoma community. This resource provides tools for UCO community members who engage in advocacy efforts outlining governing bodies, policies, Capitol visits, annual institutional messaging and more.

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

64438ce8-b31f-44f1-a0f7-e5d0d61866a5.description: The Applied Servant Leadership micro-credential focuses on the foundational tenets of Servant Leadership. It provides participants with action oriented practices which aid to create a servant focused environment in your work and among colleagues.

Integrated Simulation

7cd2c465-93bb-4f13-ad95-0da4afbb77df.description: The Black Male Summit Leadership Class is designed to create the next generation of leaders by empowering young black males through five weeks of virtual, hands-on activities. The class is designed to strengthen leadership skills, enhance self-confidence, and enrich their personal brand.

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

Identify diverse plans of action for engaging with and contributing to their communities.
Develop a plan of action for their own future goals in college, career, and community.
Personal Brand "Sales Pitch" Presentation
Personal Strengths and Leadership Qualities Cover Letter

1a6e651d-89c4-44df-8404-ea145b22d40e.description: To earn the Diversity and Inclusion Budgeting micro-credential, students must choose an event and design an accompanying budget and payment plan. The budget should be designed with particular thought given to contingencies and cost-benefit analysis. After the event's completion, earners must evaluate the efficacy of their budget design and submit a personal reflection. Students will address areas for improvement.
1a6e651d-89c4-44df-8404-ea145b22d40e.name: Diversity & Inclusion Budgeting

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

Identify all possible expenses for an event or organization
Prioritize financial success by imparting knowledge of budget restrictions to all team members
Apply a range of soft skills, including resilience, flexibility, and personal responsibility
Maintain an adequate budget to cover known and potential costs
Make informed predictions about future costs
Reflect on the success of budget management in a planned and completed event

f02222aa-21f2-4270-ad51-9ca88a80e29f.description: This micro-credential is earned by students who demonstrate proficiency in problem solving and critical thinking. Students interested in earning this digital badge will develop an action plan to solve a problem and carry out that plan. Afterwards, they will evaluate the efficacy of their plan and submit a personal reflection. They will detail the potential barriers they sought to overcome, and how successful their efforts were in practice.
f02222aa-21f2-4270-ad51-9ca88a80e29f.name: Diversity & Inclusion Critical Thinking and Problem Solving

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

Predict the likelihood of encountering issues associated with a particular task
Apply equal weight to all perspectives, including those that differ from one's own
Assess issues from all possible perspectives
Apply a range of soft skills, including resilience, flexibility, and personal responsibility
Use knowledge of differing perspectives to design creative solutions
Implement strategies to reach acceptable compromises
Adapt to obstacles in solving problems
Reflect on completed event and use of critical thinking to solve problems

6b692282-16ad-44d1-a506-c732ef7e7279.description: Earners must choose an event and design an accompanying risk management plan. The plan should include an outline of potential liabilities and a detailed strategy to mitigate those risks. After the event's completion, earners must evaluate the efficacy of their risk management plan and submit a personal reflection. Students will address areas for improvement as well as successes and complete an adjusted plan.
6b692282-16ad-44d1-a506-c732ef7e7279.name: Diversity & Inclusion Risk Management

de50edf2-35bc-44e7-b3ca-0a14609fc68c.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed UCO's NTRN 4704 - Institutional Food Management academic course. They have a working knowledge and experience of food and beverage operations due to their semester long industry-based work experience within UCO’s on campus restaurant, Central Station. Central station is a student-run restaurant, offering nutrition students a hands-on lab to practice food service and management skills.

e0528497-e217-4a90-aba5-454dc6c94fcf.description: The College-to-Career Transition micro-credential is designed to provide the learner with the tools to successfully apply for a job upon graduation. ef783db0-8f6b-41ac-af31-4a3704ec457c.description: The Facilitating Social Change micro-credential represents verified abilities to facilitate change within diverse social contexts. As part of the Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential suite, this micro-credential provides opportunities to grow and communicate capabilities to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. The earner of this badge completed one or more of the criteria listed below.

Lead inclusive change.
Relate perspectives on justice across multiple disciplines and points of view.

Demonstrated proficiency in the micro-credential competencies through one of the following opportunities: • Reflection Paper in Criminal Justice Practicum • Agency Project in Criminal Justice Pro-Seminar • Reflection Paper in Sociology Practicum • Advocacy Project in Sociology Institute of Hope • Portfolio in Civic Leadership Capstone

e1aedfa9-8893-4e0a-9fa4-a0b7680d73c0.description: The Foundations of Justice micro-credential represents verified foundational knowledge of justice within diverse social systems and structures. As part of the Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential suite, this micro-credential provides opportunities to grow and communicate capabilities to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. The earner of this badge completed one or more of the criteria listed below.
e1aedfa9-8893-4e0a-9fa4-a0b7680d73c0.name: Foundations for Justice

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Ability to define justice.
Describe the connected nature and artifact of society.
Compare different demographics, relationship, and intersections to greater society.
Describe approaches to organizational change.
Identify the process of forming, implementing, and changing policy (policy analysis).
Describe the forms of justice and/or injustice takes in society.
Identify functions and roles influencing social change.
Describe common terms, context, communication related to social change.

Demonstrated proficiency in all the of micro-credential competencies through one of the following opportunities: • Final Synthesis Paper in Criminal Justice Inside Out Prison Exchange • Final Synthesis Paper in Sociology Minorities in American Society • IDI Project in Political Science Cultural Competency in Orgs • IDI Project in Sociology Intercultural Competency • Final Call to Action Reflection Paper in Leadership and Cultural Com

96bcca70-080e-4c17-bcf4-2506e9ce0239.description: Earners of the JavaScript for Front End Web badge have completed UCO's CMSC 5910 Front End Web Programming course. In this course, students will learn how to create interactive web pages using JavaScript. Topics include web page creation using HTML elements and CSS properties, Document Object Model (DOM), dynamic changes of DOM using JavaScript.
96bcca70-080e-4c17-bcf4-2506e9ce0239.name: JavaScript for Front End Web

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand basic elements of HTML and CSS properties
Use HTML forms and input elements to interact with the client
Understand basics of JavaScript programming language
Handle events on the web browser
Write JavaScript programs to develop the interactive web page

88a64a92-ad02-4ced-a684-026dcc96e85e.description: Earners of this badge are UCO students who have completed the Leaders of Tomorrow Scholarship Program.
88a64a92-ad02-4ced-a684-026dcc96e85e.name: Leaders of Tomorrow Scholarship Program

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Required to be involved in at least one student organization.
Participate in various group service projects throughout the course of the year.
Attendance at monthly council meetings is required in addition to the LOT banquet and summer retreat.
Academic courses related to leadership are also required for students who enter the program as a freshman.
Attend optional events include class gatherings, LOT President's Christmas Party, Winter Retreat, Homecoming activities, etc.
Maintain a 3.0 GPA each semester.
Submit a leadership reflection paper each semester.

8a713064-6313-4d3d-ad70-f843e75df1ca.description: The Leading Social Change micro-credential represents verified abilities in leading social change. As part of the Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential suite, this micro-credential provides opportunities to grow and communicate capabilities to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. The earner of this badge completed one or more of the criteria listed below.
8a713064-6313-4d3d-ad70-f843e75df1ca.name: Leading Social Change

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Explain a leader's role in social change.
Describe leadership values related to social change.
Apply social change leadership models and practices to applied scenarios.

Demonstrated proficiency in the micro-credential competencies through one of the following opportunities: • Case Study Analysis in Leadership and Civic Engagement • Social Movement Leader Profile in Leadership and Social Movements

81f1ad5e-c123-447a-8c61-5db03e0fd3f8.description: Earners of this badge have a working knowledge and experience in library cataloging and metadata work gained through a semester-long internship with UCO Chambers Library’s Metadata & Cataloging department. This internship is designed to familiarize students with concepts and tools relating to cataloging and provide real-world, hands-on experiences in creating and editing bibliographic metadata.
81f1ad5e-c123-447a-8c61-5db03e0fd3f8.name: Metadata & Cataloging Intern

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Learn foundations of copy cataloging.
Recognize unique qualities of different catalog resources.
Use software (e.g. Excel) to identify and edit metadata for remediation in online repository.
Use library software (e.g. Alma, OCLC Connexion) to create and edit bibliographic records.
Apply controlled vocabularies (e.g. LCSH, FAST headings) accurately to bibliographic records.
Perform complex copy and derived cataloging.

86113714-be58-4727-b173-a9b663b3e11c.description: Clear and persuasive communication is an essential capability needed to thrive in today’s world of education and work. The Persuasive Presentation Techniques micro-credential demonstrates the capability to plan, create, and deliver presentations that engage audiences and advocate for change. The knowledge, skills, and abilities included in this micro-credential represent essential techniques for advocacy and using persuasive communication techniques in practical situations.
86113714-be58-4727-b173-a9b663b3e11c.name: Persuasive Presentation Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Outline elements of persuasive presentations.
Conduct research on a specific topic.
Develop visual materials for persuasive presentations.
Demonstrate effective presentation delivery skills.
Integrate communication skills into a concise, persuasive presentation.
Advocate ideas through a persuasive presentation.
Adapt communication approach to an audience.
Delivery of persuasive presentation that demonstrates proficiency of all competencies.

8ee99c01-8926-46ea-9e4e-c0c5b9c82a01.description: The Planning Social Change Strategies micro-credential represents verified skills in creating strategies for leading social change. As part of the Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential suite, this micro-credential provides opportunities to grow and communicate capabilities to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. The earner of this badge completed one or more of the criteria listed below.
8ee99c01-8926-46ea-9e4e-c0c5b9c82a01.name: Planning Social Change Strategies

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Incorporate role of active and passive representation within decision-making processes.
Develop marketing strategies for social change.

Demonstrated proficiency in all of the of micro-credential competencies through one of the following opportunities: • Research and Change Paper in Criminal Justice Research and Planning • Organizational Analysis in Political Science Cultural Competency in Orgs • Social Justice Campaign in Sociology Social Innovation and Advocacy

1ff8cb60-b037-4414-8c8c-e11c472cc6cb.description: The Policy Analysis for Social Change micro-credential represents verified skills in analyzing policies using a social change framework. As part of the Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential suite, this micro-credential provides opportunities to grow and communicate capabilities to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. The earner of this badge completed one or more of the criteria listed below.
1ff8cb60-b037-4414-8c8c-e11c472cc6cb.name: Policy Analysis for Social Change

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct policy analysis.

Demonstrated proficiency in the micro-credential competency through one of the following opportunities: • Policy Analysis Project in Political Science Policy Analysis • Final Analysis Paper in Sociology Social Welfare Policy • Critical Issues Project in Critical Issues in Criminal Justice

076e3b22-1385-43c3-9a33-8fe4fb5f7aa9.description: Students will learn editing skills as well as human communication and client-facing skills. Students will be exposed to some of the real-world realities of editing as well as practical editing skills.
076e3b22-1385-43c3-9a33-8fe4fb5f7aa9.name: Practical Skills for Editors

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand how to edit a text to evoke the desired tone and purpose for an audience.
Learn key aspects of the editing industry to prepare for a career in editing.
Practice creating documents that are likely to be found in a workplace.
Manipulate text for optimal intelligibility and clarity.
Market your personal brand as an editor through social media.
Navigate sensitive editorial situations like giving feedback.

09680582-2c69-4bb0-b658-23f855a02980.description: Earners of this badge are UCO students who have completed their active membership in the President’s Leadership Council Scholarship Program.
09680582-2c69-4bb0-b658-23f855a02980.name: President's Leadership Council Scholarship Program

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Show active involvement in at least two student organizations and are encouraged to hold office in at least one.
Students must also submit 12 hours of volunteer service each semester through UCO's Office of Community Engagement.
Attendance at monthly council meetings is required.
Various events throughout the year such as PLC Banquet and Summer Retreat are required.
Academic courses related to leadership are also required for students who enter the program as a freshman.
Attend optional events including class gatherings, PLC President's Holiday Party, Winter Retreat, and Homecoming activities.
Maintain a 3.0 GPA each semester.
Active involvement is reported through monthly activity reports.

1350b304-b83d-42af-b8a4-3ea2471bdd2e.description: The Process Improvement for Nursing micro-credential represents an earner’s proficiency in foundational methods and skills for improving processes within applied nursing contexts. This micro-credential is specifically designed to equip Nurses with the capabilities to apply process improvement practices in diverse Nursing settings.
1350b304-b83d-42af-b8a4-3ea2471bdd2e.name: Process Improvement for Nursing

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Compare process improvement methods in Nursing.
Analyze organizational processes in Nursing contexts
Design processes for Nursing contexts.

f29b6094-3c3e-4c58-8dac-8a999e4d7f7a.description: Students will complete 2 courses within the Technical Writing major/minor where they will learn more about how to write for, and work with, different audiences with diverse needs. Students will learn about multiple accessibility tools in order to reach a wider audience.
f29b6094-3c3e-4c58-8dac-8a999e4d7f7a.name: Technical Composition for Diverse Audiences

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the principles of accessible language and layout design to meet the needs of diverse audiences.
Adapt language to accommodate certain groups without excluding others.
Prioritize accessibility and inclusivity in all aspects of writing, editing, and designing.
Enhance inclusivity without distracting from the message.
Employ effective design to enhance accessibility in technical writing across mediums.

1e29dfbf-e24f-48dc-adad-e17cc3e4b6ca.description: Developing and growing high-performing teams is an essential capability for leaders. This micro-credential verifies proficiency in key capabilities for identifying critical learning & performance needs, and creating, delivering, & managing training and development experiences in team contexts leading to individual & organizational results. The knowledge, skills, and abilities included in this micro-credential were developed based on the Association for Talent Development (ATD) Capability Model.
1e29dfbf-e24f-48dc-adad-e17cc3e4b6ca.name: Training and Development for Team Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of adult learning principles quiz (100% accuracy)
Needs Analysis and Recommendations Report (meets all proficiency criteria)
Training Plan Project (meets all proficiency criteria)
Training and Development Resource Project (meets proficiency criteria)
Training and Development Facilitation and Management Prototype Reflection Project (meets all proficiency criteria)

36bb1561-4a7d-45bb-99f8-1190cdd09ba6.description: Earners of this badge can apply the Student Transformative Learning Record (STLR) rubric to assess the levels of transformative growth that students exhibit in 5 of the tenets of transformative learning adopted by the University of Central Oklahoma: Global & Cultural Competencies; Health & Wellness; Leadership; Research, Creative & Scholarly Activities; and Service Learning & Civic Engagement. Assessment levels are: Not Achieved, Exposure, Integration, and Transformation.
36bb1561-4a7d-45bb-99f8-1190cdd09ba6.name: Transformative Learning Assessment

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Describe UCO’s framework of transformative learning.
Describe transformative learning.
Describe and give examples of UCO’s 5 STLR-tracked tenets of transformative learning.
Match learning activities with one or more of the UCO STLR-tracked tenets.
Name and describe the potential levels of transformative learning growth.
Create criteria for the STLR rubric for each tenet and level.
Write reflective prompts that promote student critical self-reflection and evidence of transformative learning growth.
STLR-tag the activities they are offering students.
Apply the STLR rubric to assess student transformative learning growth using learning artifacts in D2L.
Completion of STLR faculty/staff training, Modules 1 and 2.

Submit the UCO STLR-tagging form for a transformative activity – to include STLR rubric criteria for one or more STLR tenets, guidance for type of learning artifact, and reflective prompts for the students.
Evidence of appropriately awarding STLR credit, at any level, to at least one student based on a student reflective artifact.

6482c3e7-caf0-45b1-b702-162e3cd9e3e2.description: The Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community micro-credential provides leaders and opportunity to verify proficiency in knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to lead change in communities, organizations, and society. This micro-credential represents successful completion of the Foundations of Justice, Policy Analysis for Social Change, Planning Social Change Strategies, Leading Social Change, and Social Change Facilitation micro-credentials.
6482c3e7-caf0-45b1-b702-162e3cd9e3e2.name: Transforming Justice, Leadership, and the Community

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations for Justice
Policy Analysis for Social Change
Planning Social Change Strategies
Leading Social Change
Facilitating Social Change

68718706-cbed-44f5-9dcb-70ae95c570da.description: This micro-credential is designed to introduce the learner to essential workplace soft skills in high demand by prospective employers. Learners will be exposed to best practices for successfully working and interacting with others in the workplace. They will gain a deeper understanding of how their attitude and behaviors impact their ability to form relationships, create trust and dependability, and effectively contribute to the success of a team.
68718706-cbed-44f5-9dcb-70ae95c570da.name: Workplace Soft Skills

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Learn how to give and receive constructive feedback
Identify the qualities found in resilient people and strategies for developing a growth mindset
Develop strategies to become more confident in taking initiative
Acquire knowledge to successfully write an email in proper format
Gain insight for improving your emotional intelligence
UCO College of Business Student Success Center ensures completion of all educational experience criteria.

2ddf33a4-ea12-4770-b59e-c1324022f585.description: Students will learn about the history of scientific rhetoric and how that impacts contemporary science writing. Students will learn about the language and style choices that are often part of science writing.
2ddf33a4-ea12-4770-b59e-c1324022f585.name: Writing and Research for Scientific Purposes

issuer.summary: issued by University of Central Oklahoma

badge_template_activities.title: Understand science writing as a genre and the rhetorical moves that it makes.
Understand how the determination of authorship, grant-funding, and other logistic factors impact writing for science.
Engage with the history of science writing as it pertains to bias, on both and individual and cultural level.
Exercise and hone general research skills, such as time management, data management, and effective communication.
Invoke active or passive voice appropriately.
Follow conventions of science writing, including correct usage of the IMRAD organizational structure and standard linguistic style.
Quickly and accurately parse relevant scientific jargon.
